Mission Statement

The mission of the UMass Belly Dance Club (UBDC) is to teach and perform the beautiful and ancient art of belly dance at the University of Massachusetts Amherst. UBDC’s goal is to inspire and empower students to celebrate and love their bodies regardless of size, age, gender, race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, or ability; thus raising self esteem and promoting a community of acceptance. UBDC’s passion is to share these goals, values, and talents with the UMass Amherst community. 

All members of the UMass Belly Dance Club are entitled to freedom of speech and will not under any circumstances be deprived of the opportunity to share their opinion with the group.
Under no circumstances will a member or potential member of the UMass Belly Dance Club be discriminated against due to race, ethnicity, gender, age, orientation, religion or other identities.


I. Membership
A. All Five College Consortium undergraduate and graduate students are eligible to be a UBDC member. Any Non-Umass Student will have to pay to use the Recreation Center for practices as per Rec Center policy. The majority of this group must be made up of undergraduate UMass Amherst students. Graduate students and Five College undergraduate students are not eligible to hold UBDC leadership positions as per Student Activities and Involvement (SAI) policy.
B. Membership shall be established after a prospective member signs the club contract/ liability waiver and pays dues. Prospective members will then be added to the Campus Pulse roster and will remain active members if they attend weekly meetings.  For liability and safety concerns, as well as according to SAI regulations, members who do not sign the contract or pay dues will be unable to be members of UBDC.
C. Dues, the cost of which are subject to change every semester depending on club needs, are collected by the Treasurer at the beginning of every new semester to aid with the cost of props and prop repair, event planning costs, costume costs for those with financial issues, etc. They are to be in a sealed envelope with the member's name and email written on it with exact change inside. All prospective members of UBDC are required to pay dues except for graduate students and Five College students (because they pay to use the rec-center each week) and those with demonstrated financial need. Any member who demonstrates financial need to the Treasurer will be exempt from paying dues. Once dues have been paid, the Treasurer will add members names to a Google document to keep track of who has paid.
D. Club Contract: The UBDC member contract will be enforced by the general board and followed at all times by every member. It will be given to every new member at the start of each semester and kept on file by the Secretary for returning members until they graduate or leave UBDC (unless changes have been made to the contract each person was given in previous semesters). The Secretary is responsible for the collection and distribution of the contract and liability waivers from SAI. They will later input all names into a Google document to keep track of who has signed it. The forms will be put into a binder for the Secretary to maintain. The contract will be reviewed by the board who will decide to make changes if necessary at the end of every semester. If changes are made, it will be re-distributed to the group at the start of the semester. 

The contract is as follows: UMass Belly Dance Club Member Contract:

 I hereby agree to read, understand, and follow the guidelines set forth in this contract in order to be an official member of UBDC:

During UBDC meetings and rehearsals, we have specific goals to reach: choreography to teach and learn, events to plan, and exciting news to share about performances.  So that we can reach these goals together and refrain from distracting others during our practice time, we ask that everyone gives the instructors their full attention and listens actively while they are speaking. Instructors will ask if anyone has questions or needs extra help while learning our group dances. Questions and comments are welcomed at this time. By raising your hand, an instructor can answer your question(s), take you aside to assist you or you may share your ideas with the group.

To attend UBDC practices and perform, prospective members must sign forms and pay dues at the beginning of each semester, attend practices regularly, and come to practice on time. Forms will be collected by the Secretary on the date that they specify.  Financial issues may be brought to the attention of the Treasurer who will assist should the need arise (please do not let cost keep you from joining UBDC).  5 College undergraduate students do not need to pay dues as they must pay to enter the Rec Center. All paperwork and dues need to be turned in within the time frame that the Treasurer will announce at the beginning of the semester. They are to be in a sealed envelope with exact change inside. The front of the envelope must include your  name and email address.  Dues that are not paid on time will result in a meeting with the Treasurer to discuss financial situations or an inability to attend practices/events. After paying dues, members will be invited to the Campus Pulse roster via email and need to accept to complete membership. They will also be invited to join our UBDC members-only Facebook group.  
  
   3.  	UBDC’s members will be informed of performance opportunities as they arise. Performing is 
always optional. All members are expected to answer polls, posts, or emails regarding availability for performing in a timely manner. Even if you cannot perform, it is more helpful to know that you cannot make it than to have no idea if we will have enough members present to perform. At performances, members are expected to arrive on time and present themselves in a manner that is respectful to the club and belly dance as an art form. Costumes are ordered online by every performer individually (unless otherwise specified) and you must do it within a timely manner to be able to perform and avoid shipping issues. Again, should financial or ordering issues occur, contact the Costume Coordinator or the Treasurer for assistance. Never let cost keep you from performing! Members should not wear belly dance costumes anywhere other than practice spaces or the performance stage (for example, in a dining common while getting dinner after a show). Walking around in costume before or after events without a form of cover up is not permitted as it is unprofessional and we do not want our audience members seeing the costumes before we perform. Examples of exceptions include tabling at the activities expo or taking a picture with friends after a show.  Ask an instructor if you have any questions about this.  Performing is a privilege. If practices are not attended and choreography is not learned, a member will  lose the ability to perform. Valid excuses given in a timely manner (at least 24 hours in advance) for missed rehearsal time include papers/projects, exams, and emergencies like sickness, injury, family issues, etc. If three regular club practices are missed after the mid-semester date, a member will not be allowed to perform if they do not make up the time at an optional practice session. 

       4. 	UBDC is not responsible for the individual actions and decisions of members at events that are 
not club-sponsored. This includes, but is not limited to social events,  professional belly dance gigs, and outside practices led by members and not UBDC instructors (Executive Board).  Any UBDC member who performs professionally at an event that is not sponsored by UBDC is expected to perform as an individual under their own name and not as a member of UBDC.
      
    
   5.  	Members who borrow props from UBDC will have to sign them out. If they are not returned by 
the end of the semester, the member who signed them out will lose borrowing privileges and will have to pay to replace the prop. They will not be permitted to take out another prop until the missing one is recollected or replaced.  Anyone who returns props damaged will have to pay the club for the replacement of pieces or the entire prop.

       6.     UBDC members are expected to be accepting and respectful of all races, ethnicities, religions, 
classes, gender orientations, and identities.   If a member of UBDC violates our atmosphere of mutual respect in any manner at any time or place, (whether at meetings, events or via social media, etc), they will be notified that their standing will be discussed by the UBDC Board and depending on the severity of the case, they may receive a formal warning or if necessary, may not remain a member of the club.

In closing, our members uphold the mission of the UMass Belly Dance Club which is to teach and perform the beautiful and ancient art of belly dance at the University of Massachusetts Amherst. UBDC’s goal is to inspire and empower students to celebrate and love their bodies regardless of size, age, gender, race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, or ability; thus raising self esteem and promoting a community of acceptance. UBDC’s passion is to share these goals, values, and talents with the UMass Amherst community. Our goal this year is to have fun dancing together as a belly dance family and community, host great events, and help one another improve dance skills in an inclusive, fun and welcoming environment.  


By signing, I agree to the terms of this contract:





Printed Name:                                                     Signature and Date:




II. Meetings and Rehearsals 

A. Active members are highly encouraged to attend weekly UBDC general body meetings to learn choreography and rehearse as a group. 	If a member intends to perform, weekly rehearsals are mandatory as missing three practices without a valid and timely excuse will result in the inability to perform. By participating in a Mullins Center cleaning shift, members can earn one free absence. Rehearsals and meetings are for the purpose of warming up, teaching choreography and technique, practicing, and/or event planning. 
B. Meetings and rehearsals will be instructed and led by the Executive Board. The President and Vice-President are responsible for creating UBDC’s choreographies together. They must seek feedback from the Secretary and Treasurer, but will take on the majority of the choreographing responsibility. These teachers should be aware that movements or parts of the choreography may not always be liked or doable by the general body. Other members should be encouraged to give their input on the choreography during rehearsals as long as it does inhibit productivity during practices. 
C. Weekly board meetings will be attended by all board members for the purposes of planning.

III. The UBDC Board:

The UBDC board will be made up of UMass Amherst undergraduate students only:

A. The Executive Board of UBDC shall be:

President: 
They are the Chief Executive Officer of the RSO. 
They are responsible for overseeing all aspects of the functioning of the group and must have Signature Responsibility and attend activation training yearly. 
The President is responsible for being the primary contact of the group and booking performances for UBDC after checking in with the general board about each one.
They are responsible for facilitating our general body and board meetings. 
They are responsible for reserving our space, time, and day at the Rec Center and are responsible for all meetings on the behalf of UBDC. 
The President will be responsible for creating and teaching choreography for performances along with the help of the Vice President (they will check in with the Secretary and Treasurer for choreography feedback).
Monitors the UBDC email account with the Secretary and the Event Coordinator.
The President is eligible to sign off on prop sign out logs.
They will monitor and assist with all aspects of the group’s functioning including, but not limited to: event planning, costume ordering, social media, publicity, finances, fundraising, and will be responsible for working on any difficulties within the group that may arise. 
The President is expected to consult with the board or an adviser on major decisions regarding UBDC. 
Finally, the President is responsible for writing the constitution and maintaining it throughout their time in their position. They are required to show it to the general board during a board meeting before the spring semester ends to get all input and approval on matters and make changes if necessary. If half of the board or more agrees that a point needs to be edited or deleted, it will be done. If the group cannot come to a unanimous decision, the adviser of the group will have the final say.
They are expected to attend weekly board meetings on time and be active, undergraduate members of UBDC.

Vice President: 
They are the second in command of the RSO. 
They are eligible to attend activation training as a representative from UBDC.
The Vice President shall take over duties for the President when they are not present and will also assist the President in all duties related to the functioning of UBDC. 
They will assist in teaching weekly classes/meetings and with creating choreography.
They will assist with all aspects of the groups functioning including, but not limited to: event planning, costume ordering, social media, publicity, finances, fundraising, and will be responsible for working on any difficulties within the group that may arise. 
The Vice-President will be responsible for finding representation from the board for any council or SAI required meetings.
They are expected to attend weekly board meetings on time and be active, undergraduate members of UBDC.

Secretary:  
They will be responsible for maintaining all records for the RSO including documents relevant to the functioning of the group (for example, the club contract and liability waivers). These records, in all possible cases, will be collected electronically and shall be passed on from the current to the future Secretary during the transition period. 
The Secretary will record minutes at all official group-planning meetings with club committees. 
The Secretary will record attendance when necessary and minutes at all board meetings. They will collect bullet points from the board for meeting topics and send out an agenda ahead of time to all board members including what was mentioned at the last board meeting. 
They are eligible to attend activation training as a representative from UBDC.
They will assist in teaching weekly classes/meetings and will give input with choreography when asked by the President and Vice-President. They are responsible for knowing the choreography to assist in teaching when necessary as assistant choreographers.
They will monitor the campus pulse roster with those who have completed the contract and the Treasurer who will add records of who’s paid dues. They are expected to keep it updated with only active members who have both paid dues and filled out the contract. 
The Secretary is responsible for keeping a log of the members who borrow props. 
They are expected to attend weekly board meetings on time and be active, undergraduate members of UBDC.

Treasurer: 
The Treasurer will be the Chief Financial Officer of the RSO. 
They will be responsible for maintaining the group’s finances, including keeping current with our Summit accounts, and for all fundraising initiatives including the publicity and organization of them. Any other board member who needs to use UBDC funds must inform the Treasurer before they make purchases of anything necessary for events, apparel, etc.
They will be responsible for submitting an annual budget request to the SGA with the help of the President. 
They will be responsible for the collection and recording of dues and any other payments. 
They will be required to have Signature Responsibility.
They will be required to submit purchase requests or procard requests when necessary.
They will assist in teaching weekly classes/meetings and will give input with choreography when asked by the President and Vice-President. They are responsible for knowing the choreography to assist in teaching when necessary as assistant choreographers.
They will monitor the campus pulse roster with those who have completed the contract and the Treasurer who will add records of who’s paid dues. They are expected to keep it updated with only active members who have both paid dues and filled out the contract. 
They will be required to inform UBDC members what UBDC will intend to spend in the current academic year, what members should expect to spend on costumes/apparel and what we will do with dues/ money donated to the club.
The treasurer is eligible to sign off on prop logs as a board member with signature responsibility.
They are expected to attend weekly board meetings on time and be active, undergraduate members of UBDC.

B. The General Board shall include the Executive Board and:

2 Event Coordinators: 
They will be in charge of everything regarding event planning with the assistance of the board if necessary including but not limited to: invitations, decorations, set up/break down, catering, thank you notes/emails, booking photographers/videographers, assisting the Publicist with advertising, etc. 
Event coordinators specifically work on our Belly Dance Festival in the Spring and our Fall Showcase as well as any showcases or RSO events we may co-host with other groups.
They are expected to attend weekly board meetings on time and be active, undergraduate members of UBDC.
1 Costume Coordinators: 
They will choose the costumes for each semester with the assistance of the board via check ins.
They will assist members with ordering/delivery questions and are responsible for getting order links to all members as well as the distribution of any pieces that arrive in bulk.
They will troubleshoot should issues arise with ordering costume pieces and be the point of contact between UBDC and our costume sellers. 
They will assist members who need help with costume fit.
They will also design the UBDC gear/apparel to be ordered each spring semester. 
They are expected to attend weekly board meetings on time and be active, undergraduate members of UBDC.
1 Publicist: 
They will be in charge of UBDC’s social media representation and advertising with input from the general body via photos, videos, etc.
Their social media duties include: creating facebook events, uploading youtube videos on our account, advertising via posters, posting instagram photos, table tents etc, tweeting, posting photos/statuses, keeping all social media pages up to date which will be done by the publicist only.
They will assist the Event Coordinators with all event advertising.
They are expected to be in communication with the board about posting and mindful of what they post. *Passwords are to be shared among the publicist and President only if security issues arise.  
They are expected to attend weekly board meetings on time and be active, undergraduate members of UBDC.

*The President, Vice President and Publicist will be the only administrators on the UBDC Facebook fan page. The President, Vice President and Secretary will be the only administrators in the UBDC member private group. Administrators must be UMass students who are active members of UBDC. 
**While each member of the board has specific responsibilities, it must be stressed that the board is a TEAM. The board must help each other as needed and sometimes do things that are not a part of their assigned duties. If it becomes so that any board member effectively does not perform their duties, please refer to section IV of this document. 

C. Election of Board Members: 

The UBDC Constitution will be available on Campus Pulse for all members to read about the requirements of the election process. 
UBDC board members are permitted to fill their positions for one year; however, provided that they complete their duties completely and efficiently, they may re-run for the retention of their position. If nobody chooses to run against them, they will be awarded their position.
At the end of each year, the general body will be informed about elections; any member of UBDC who has been an active member of UBDC for two consecutive semesters may run for a board position. 

* New officers should be elected in the spring after spring break to ensure enough time to train under the current officers until they leave the position. New officers are officially in their position after the last day of classes during the Spring semester.

1. The required traits for all UBDC board members are as follows:

A board member must be mature, warm, welcoming, responsible, trustworthy and positive.
Dedication to the club is a MUST. This member must have displayed dedication by coming to the majority of meetings every week on time for at least two consecutive semesters, perform often, volunteer, assist in fundraising efforts, etc.
Public speaking skills: this will be crucial when it comes to teaching the group. Board members should be comfortable speaking in front of a large group of people.  Teachers: (Executive Board) should be comfortable dancing, teaching, improving and performing in front of large groups.
Timely and organized: Board members must be dedicated enough to take on the responsibility of helping to run UBDC and be able to balance these responsibilities with other aspects of student life.

Everyone who embodies these qualities is eligible for a leadership position: UBDC will never be biased against different gender identities, body types, class, race/ethnicity, backgrounds, etc.

2. For the election of general board members positions: The President will inform the general body of when elections will be. They will then compile a list of the members who are interested in each position.  They will collect 1-2 paragraph long statements from each candidate stating why they want to be considered for the position and why they think they would be the best candidate.

The board will later discuss and decide if the candidates are eligible and offer positions to the most dedicated, well-rounded candidate. This discussion will take place when the candidates are not present. Each board member will submit an anonymous vote which will be tallied by the board. These votes will determine the next elected board members. The President will inform all candidates of the election outcome via email.  They will also inform the general body members however they see fit (campus pulse, email, Facebook page, etc). If a current board member is leaving their position and wants to apply for a new one, they must go through the same statement process and will not be eligible for the discussion and selection of that position. 

3. For the election of Executive Board Members: 

The President will inform the general body of when elections will be. They will compile a list of the members who are interested in the position. Candidates must give a two minute verbal presentation to the entire board stating why they want to be considered for the position and why they think they would be the best candidate. They must teach the general board a short choreography for ten minutes and answer all questions that board members ask during and after the lesson (the choreography should not take ten minutes to learn, but the process of teaching it and having the board able to do it should take ten minutes). Finally, candidates must submit a video of a solo of at least two minutes in length to the board. After a final question and answer session, the entire board will meet to discuss the candidates and decide who will fill each position by filling out an anonymous rubric based on the candidate’s teaching and leadership.  The rubric scores will be tallied by the board together. This will determine the next elected board members. The President will inform all candidates and general body members of the outcome. Any current board member running for a position will not be included in the voting or rubric process for the election of the position they wish to receive. 

Along with the required traits for all UBDC officers: anyone who is applying for teaching positions within UBDC (Executive Board) must have the following qualities which will be included in the election scoring rubric:

They must be consistently present and on time to all general body meetings, performances, and board meetings (if they were previously a member of the board). *This point weighs heavily on the Executive Board rubric.
They should be able to display an ability to choreograph versatile dance pieces by participating actively in UBDC meetings/performances. Other ways to show an active interest in expanding one’s dance abilities can include:  Displaying a knowledge of belly dance and its numerous techniques and styles by research and by taking extra classes (such as belly dance group fit classes at the Rec-center or extra classes with a professional) and performing their own solos often.  *This point weighs heavily on the Executive Board rubric.
They must display an ability to balance teaching, choreographing, attending meetings (general body, board, SAI, RSO adviser, SAI trainings, etc) and leading UBDC.
They must show an ability to handle stressful situations and adversity should difficulties within UBDC arise.
They must have performed a solo (prior to the election process) that is their original choreographed work and at least two minutes in length. To count, the solo must be performed at a UBDC sponsored event (i.e. our Festival) or at an event UBDC has been invited to perform for. Events that have audiences made up of only UBDC members (such as our Hafla) do not count
*UBDC teachers do not have to be certified belly dance instructors, however, the executive board will be sent to do one workshop with an area certified instructor to gain technique via club funds with a respected, researched and established instructor. 

Most importantly, the new elected Executive Board should have a passion for belly dance and sharing this beautiful art form with others. This member should exude a strong passion for the club and belly dance as an art. They should add to and maintain the club’s atmosphere of friendship and respect.


IV. General Board/ Executive Board Member and General Body Member Removal:
A.  Any officer who displays a lack in responsibility in their position or violates the contract of UBDC should be given a written formal warning by the President. Should the behavior persist after a written warning, the President will call a board meeting and the group will discuss and vote on the status of the board member. Any member who puts the safety of another board member or general body member in jeopardy will lose their board position and/or UBDC membership if there is proof of the incident. If the President violates the UBDC contract or displays a lack of responsibility in their position, the Vice-President is eligible to give them a written formal warning or call a board meeting to discuss their standing if the behavior persists. If the Vice-President and President are both in violation, any board member may contact the UBDC adviser to discuss the situation. 
B. If the board member in question has never received a written warning, but has behaved in a way that warrants a meeting about their status, the board must unanimously agree to remove them from their position. If the member has received one verbal and one written warning, one more than half of the board must agree to remove them from their position and the UBDC advisor must approve of the decision. If the group cannot make a decision, the member in question will state their case to the group's adviser who will make the final decision.
C. General body members who behave in any manner that violates the contract of UBDC or puts the safety of a member of UBDC in jeopardy will immediately have their status as a member be discussed by the board. The member will receive a verbal warning about said behavior, then a written warning, and if the behavior persists, the board will vote on their membership status if there is proof of the incident.  If the group cannot make a decision, the member in question will state their case to the group's adviser who will make the final decision.


V. Resolving Disputes

If anyone on the board witnesses or is made aware of behavior that makes other members uncomfortable and/or disrupts the club, every board member has the right to ask any member to engage in a private conversation about the behavior either before, during or after the club meeting in the most polite and discreet manner possible. This is to prevent further disruptions, address strife head on and prevent disputes in the future.
If a member feels they are being disrespected or feels uncomfortable, they should go directly to one of the board members as soon as possible.  It will be dealt with as the general board sees fit.  
Any board member is allowed to contact the club’s adviser for assistance at any time for any reason. 
Mediated meetings among members or board members with an adviser or the head of SAI may be called by the President or any other board member should they see fit.
The President with the assistance of the board if necessary, will mediate disputes between all members including board members. Should the need arise, a representative from SAI or adviser may mediate. 
Should the President be involved in a dispute, or should any party not be satisfied with the result of the President's mediation, any party may request that the RSO adviser shall mediate. The results of mediated conversations with the adviser shall be final.
If the issue does not pertain to UBDC or belly dance, the President and the board if necessary should suggest resources and work with the UBDC adviser to suggest the best solution.
If a member has been found to be making threats against other members, or if any member is in physical, emotional, or mental danger, then an SAI advisor will be notified immediately.

Mission Statement

The mission of the UMass Belly Dance Club is to teach and perform the beautiful and ancient art of belly dance at the University of Massachusetts Amherst. UBDC’s goal is to inspire and empower students to celebrate and love their bodies regardless of size, age, gender, race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, or ability; thus raising self esteem and promoting a community of acceptance. UBDC’s passion is to share these goals, values, and talents with the UMass Amherst community. 

All members of the UMass Belly Dance Club are entitled to freedom of speech and will not under any circumstances be deprived of the opportunity to share their opinion with the group.

Under no circumstances will a member or potential member of the UMass Belly Dance Club be discriminated against due to race, ethnicity, gender, age, orientation, religion or other factors.

I. Membership
A. Undergraduate and graduate students at the University of Massachusetts Amherst are eligible to be members of UBDC. Five college (Amherst College, Mt. Holyoke College, Hampshire College and Smith College) students are also eligible to be members of UBDC, but they must pay to use the recreation center. The majority of this group will be made up of undergraduate UMass Amherst students.
B. Membership shall be established after a prospective member signs the club contract and pays dues. Prospective members will then be added to the Campus Pulse roster and will remain active members if they attend weekly meetings.  For liability and safety concerns, as well as according to SAI regulations, members who do not sign the contract or pay dues will be unable to participate in club practices or performances.
C. Dues: $5 dues (twice yearly) will be collected by the Treasurer at the beginning of every new semester to aid with the cost of props 
and prop repair, event planning costs, costume costs for those with financial issues, etc. They are to be in a sealed envelope with the 
member's name and email written on it with exact change inside. All prospective members of UBDC are required to pay dues 
including non-undergraduate students. Any member who expresses financial issues to the President or Treasurer will be exempt from  
paying dues on a case to case basis.
D. Club Contract: The UBDC member contract will be enforced by the general board and followed at all times by every member. It will be given to every new member at the start of each semester and kept on file by the Secretary for returning members until they graduate or leave UBDC. The President is responsible for the collection and distribution of the contract and liability waivers from SAI. They will later input all names into a Google document to keep track of who has signed it that will be shared with the Secretary.  The forms will be put into a binder that will later be given to the Secretary to maintain. The contract will be reviewed by the board who will decide to make changes if necessary at the start of every semester. If changes are made, it will be re-distributed to the group at the start of the semester.

The contract is as follows: UMass Belly Dance Club Member Contract

As a member of UBDC, I hereby agree to read, understand and follow the rules set forth in our group’s contract in order to be an official member of UBDC. To be in good standing a member must: attend practices regularly, pay dues, complete forms, participate in events when available, assist with fundraising, as well as treat the UBDC leadership board and all fellow members with respect and kindness.

To be considered an official member that can attend UBDC practices and perform, members must pay dues at the beginning of each semester and attend practices regularly. Financial issues should be brought to the attention of the President or Treasurer who will assist should the need arise. All paper work and dues need to be turned in within the time frame that the President and Treasurer will announce at the beginning of the semester. They are to be in a sealed envelope with exact change inside. The front of the envelope must include the member's name and email address.  An inability to pay dues on time will result in a meeting with the Treasurer to discuss financial situations or an inability to attend practices/events. After paying dues, members will be invited to the Campus Pulse roster via email and need to accept to complete membership.

         2.  	UBDC’s members will be informed of performance opportunities as they arise. All members are expected to answer polls, posts or 	emails regarding availability for performing in a timely manner. Performing is always optional. At performances, members are 	expected to arrive on time and behave in a manner that is respectful to the club and belly dance as an art. Members should not wear 	UBDC costumes anywhere other than practice spaces or the performance stage (for example, in a dining common while getting dinner 	after a show). Walking around in costume before or after events without a form of cover up is not permitted. Examples of exceptions 	include: tabling at the activities expo or taking a picture with friends after a show. 

         3. 	Members are expected to turn in any payments for costumes/coin belts on time by the deadline set by the Treasurer. Shaker/coin belt 	payments should be in a sealed envelope with exact change inside. The envelope should include your name, email, the number of 	shakers you want and the colors.  Costumes are ordered by every performer individually and you must do it within a timely manner to 	be able to perform and avoid shipping issues. Again, should financial or ordering issues occur, contact a Costume Coordinator or the 	Treasurer for assistance. Never let cost keep you from performing!

        

 

        4.	 UBDC members are expected to be accepting and respectful of all races, ethnicities, religions, classes, gender orientations, and 	identities.   If a member of UBDC violates the atmosphere of mutual respect in any manner at any time or place, (whether at meetings, 	events or via social media, etc), they will be notified that their standing will be discussed by the UBDC Board and depending of the 	severity of the case, they may receive a formal warning or if necessary, may not remain a member of the club.

       5. 	UBDC is not responsible for the individual actions and decisions of members at events that are not club-sponsored. This includes, but 	is not limited to social events (parties), professional belly dance gigs, and outside practices led by members and not UBDC instructors 	(Executive Board). Any UBDC member who performs professionally at an event that is not sponsored by UBDC is expected to 	perform as an individual under their own name and not as a member of UBDC.
      
       6.  	Members who borrow props from UBDC will have to sign them out with the President. If they are not returned by the end of the 	semester, the member who signed them out will lose borrowing privileges and will not be permitted to take out another prop until the 	missing one is recollected.  Anyone who returns props damaged will have to pay the club for the replacement of pieces or the entire 	prop.

 In closing, our members uphold the mission of the UMass Belly Dance Club which is to teach and perform the beautiful and ancient art of belly dance at the University of Massachusetts Amherst. UBDC’s goal is to inspire and empower students to celebrate and love their bodies regardless of size, age, gender, race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, or ability; thus raising self esteem and promoting a community of acceptance. UBDC’s passion is to share these goals, values, and talents with the UMass Amherst community.

By signing, I agree to the terms of this contract:

Printed Name:                                                     Signature and Date:

II. Meetings/Rehearsals

A. 	Active members are highly encouraged to attend weekly UBDC general body meetings to learn choreography and rehearse as a group. 	If a member intends to perform, weekly rehearsals are mandatory. Rehearsals and meetings are for the purpose of warming up, 	teaching choreography and technique, practicing, and/or event planning. 
B. 	Meetings/Rehearsals will be instructed and led by the Executive Board. They are responsible for creating UBDC’s choreographies 	together. These teachers should be aware that movements or parts of the choreography may not always be liked or doable by the 	general body. Other members should be encouraged to give their input on the choreography during rehearsals as long as it does not 	 	is in agreement.
C. 	Bi-weekly board meetings will be attended by all board members for the purposes of planning. Board meetings may be held on a 	weekly basis or more frequently if necessary (festival/event planning etc).

III. The UBDC Board:

The UBDC board will be made up of UMass Amherst undergraduate students only.

A. The Executive Board of UBDC shall be:

President: 
They are the Chief Executive Officer of the RSO. 
They are responsible overseeing all aspects of the functioning of the group and must have Signature Responsibility and attend activation training yearly. 
The President is responsible for being the primary contact of the group and booking performances for UBDC.
The President is responsible for keeping a log of the members who borrow props.
They are in charge of running all meetings and must facilitate our board meetings. They must also create surveys to decide on bi-weekly meeting times for the general board.
They are responsible for reserving our space, time, and day at the Rec Center and are responsible for all meetings on the behalf of UBDC. 
The President will be responsible for creating and teaching choreography for performances along with the help of the Vice President, Secretary or Treasurer. 
They will monitor and assist with all aspects of the group’s functioning including, but not limited to: event planning, costume ordering, social media, publicity, finances, fundraising, and will be responsible for working on any difficulties within the group that may arise. 
The President is expected to consult with the board or an adviser on major decisions regarding UBDC. 
Finally, the President is responsible for writing the constitution and maintaining it throughout their time in their position. They are required to show it to the general board during a board meeting before the spring semester ends to get all input and approval on matters and make changes if necessary. If half of the board or more agrees that a point needs to be edited or deleted, it will be done. If the group cannot come to a unanimous decision, the adviser of the group will have the final say.





Vice President: 
They are the second in command of the RSO. 
They are eligible to attend activation training as a representative from UBDC.
The Vice President shall take over duties for the President when they are not present and will also assist the President in all duties related to the functioning of UBDC. 
They will assist in teaching weekly classes/meetings and with creating choreography.
They will monitor the campus pulse roster with the help of the Secretary who will have records of who has completed the contract and the Treasurer who will have records of who’s paid dues. They are expected to keep it updated with only active members who have both paid dues and filled out the contract. 
They will assist with all aspects of the groups functioning including, but not limited to: event planning, costume ordering, social media, publicity, finances, fundraising, and will be responsible for working on any difficulties within the group that may arise. 
The Vice-President will be responsible for finding representation from the board for any council or SAI required meetings.

Secretary:  
They will be responsible for maintaining all records for the RSO including documents relevant to the functioning of the group (for example, the club contract or liability waivers). These records, in all possible cases, will be collected electronically and shall be passed on from the current to the future Secretary during the transition period. Liability waivers should be brought to the SAI adviser of the group.
The Secretary will record minutes at all official group-planning meetings with club committees. 
The Secretary will record attendance when necessary and minutes at all board meetings. They will collect bullet points from the board for meeting topics and send out an agenda ahead of time to all board members including what was mentioned at the last board meeting. 
They are eligible to attend activation training as a representative from UBDC.
They will assist in teaching weekly classes/meetings and with choreography.

Treasurer: 
The Treasurer will be the Chief Financial Officer of the RSO. 
They will be responsible for maintaining the group’s finances and for all fundraising initiatives including the publicity and organization of them. Any other board member who needs to use UBDC funds must inform the Treasurer before they make purchases of anything necessary for events, apparel, etc.
They will be responsible for submitting an annual budget request to the SGA with the help of the President. 
They will be responsible for the collection and recording of dues and any other payments.  
They will be required to have Signature Responsibility.
They are eligible to teach at weekly classes/meetings and assist with choreography. This is optional for Treasurers.
They will be required to inform UBDC members what UBDC will intend to spend in the current academic year, what members should expect to spend on costumes/apparel and what we will do with dues/ money donated to the club.

B. The General Board shall include the Executive Board and:
2 Event Coordinators: 
They will be in charge of everything regarding event planning with the assistance of the board if necessary including but not limited to: invitations,  decoration, set up/break down, catering, AV, lighting, thank you notes/emails, booking photographers/videographers, assisting the Publicist(s) with advertising, etc. 
Event coordinators specifically work on our Belly Dance Festival in the Spring, any showcases or RSO events we may host and team bonding events.
They are expected to attend bi-weekly board meetings (and more frequent board meetings if necessary) on time and be active, undergraduate members of UBDC.
1-2 Costume Coordinators: 
They will choose the costumes for each semester with the assistance of the Executive Board if necessary.
They will assist members with ordering/delivery and are responsible for getting order links to all members
They will troubleshoot should issues arise with ordering costume pieces and be the point of contact between UBDC and our costume sellers.
They will also design the UBDC gear/apparel to be ordered each spring semester. 
They are expected to attend bi-weekly board meetings (and more frequent board meetings if necessary) on time and be active, undergraduate members of UBDC.
1 Publicist: 
They will be in charge of UBDC’s social media representation and advertising with the assistance of the Executive Board.  
Their social media duties include: creating facebook events, advertising via posters, table tents etc, tweeting, posting photos/statuses, keeping all social media pages up to date, (which is to be done by the publicist and the eboard only). 
They will assist the Event Coordinator(s) with all event advertising.

They are expected to be in communication with the President about posting and mindful of what they post. *Passwords are to be shared among the publicist and President only.  
They are expected to attend bi-weekly board meetings (and more frequent board meetings if necessary) on time and be active, undergraduate members of UBDC.

*The Executive Board and Publicist will be the only administrators on the UBDC Facebook  fan page. The Executive Board will be the only administrators in the UBDC member private group. Administrators must be UMass students who are active members of UBDC. 

C. Election of Board Members: 

The UBDC Constitution will be available on Campus Pulse for all members to read about the requirements of the election process. 
UBDC board members are permitted to fill their positions for one year; however, provided that they complete their duties completely and efficiently, they may remain in their position for as long as they like until their graduation date. 
If a board member wishes to fill their position for longer than one year, they must present their reasoning to the board who will vote on their extended position time. If one more than half of the board agrees to allow them to remain in their position, they may for another year long term. This process may be completed every year for those who wish to remain in their positions.

* New officers should be elected in the spring after spring break to ensure enough time to train under the current officers until they leave the position. New officers are officially in their position after the last day of classes during the Spring semester.

1. The required traits for all UBDC board members are as follows:

A board member must be mature, warm, welcoming, responsible, trustworthy and positive.
Dedication to the club is a MUST. This member must have displayed dedication by coming to meetings every week on time for at least one semester, performing often, volunteering, assisting in fundraising efforts, etc.
Public speaking skills: this will be crucial when it comes to teaching the group. Board members should be comfortable speaking in front of a large group of people.  Teachers: (Executive Board) should be comfortable dancing, teaching, improving and performing in front of large groups.
Timely and organized: Board members must be dedicated enough to take on the responsibility of helping to run UBDC and be able to balance these responsibilities with other aspects of student life.

Everyone who embodies these qualities is eligible for a leadership position: UBDC will never be biased against different gender identities, body types, class, race/ethnicity, backgrounds, etc.

2. For the election of general board members positions: The President will inform the general body of UBDC if there will be any vacancies for the next semester. They will then compile a list of the members who are interested in the position. The entire board will then meet with those on the list who will give a two minute presentation at a board meeting stating why they want to be considered for the position and why they think they would be the best candidate (if for any reason a candidate cannot meet for the presentation process, they may submit their statement in writing or via video to display their public speaking skills if they wish).

The board will later discuss and decide if the candidates are eligible and offer positions to the most dedicated, well-rounded candidate. This discussion will take place when the candidates are not present. Each board member will submit an anonymous vote which will be tallied by the President. These votes will determine the next elected board members. The President will inform all candidates of the election outcome via email.  They will also inform the general body members however they see fit (campus pulse, email, Facebook page, etc). If a current board member is leaving their position and wants to apply for a new one, they must go through the same presentation process and will not be eligible for the discussion and selection of that position. 

3. For the election of Executive Board Members: 

The current President will inform the members of UBDC if there will be any vacancies for the next semester. They will compile a list of the members who are interested in the position. Candidates must give a two minute verbal presentation to the entire board stating why they want to be considered for the position and why they think they would be the best candidate. They must teach the general board a short choreography for ten minutes and answer all questions that board members ask during and after the lesson (the choreography should not take ten minutes to learn, but the process of teaching it and having the board able to do it should take ten minutes). Finally, candidates must perform a two minute  solo that is their own work in front of the general board. After a final question and answer session, the entire board will meet to discuss the candidates and decide who will fill each position by filling out an anonymous rubric based on the candidate’s teaching and leadership.  The rubric scores will be tallied by the board together. This will determine the next elected board members. The President will inform all candidates and general body members of the outcome.

Along with the required traits for all UBDC officers: anyone who is applying for teaching positions within UBDC (Executive Board) must have the following qualities which will be included in the election scoring rubric:

They must be consistently present and on time to all general body meetings, performances, and board meetings (if they were previously a member of the board). *This point weighs heavily on the Executive Board rubric.
They should be able to display an ability to choreograph versatile dance pieces by participating actively in UBDC meetings/performances. Other ways to show an active interest in expanding one’s dance abilities can include:  Displaying a knowledge of belly dance and its numerous techniques and styles by research and by taking extra classes (such as belly dance group fit classes at the Rec-center or extra classes with a professional) and performing their own solos often.  *This point weighs heavily on the Executive Board rubric.
They must display an ability to balance teaching, choreographing, attending meetings (general body, board, SAI, RSO adviser, SAI trainings, etc) and leading UBDC.
They must show an ability to handle stressful situations and adversity should difficulties within UBDC arise.
They must have performed a solo (prior to the election process) that is their original choreographed work and at least two minutes in length. To count, the solo must be performed at a UBDC sponsored event (i.e. our Festival) or at an event UBDC has been invited to perform for. Events that have audiences made up of only UBDC members (such as our Hafla) do not count
*UBDC teachers do not have to be certified belly dance instructors.

Most importantly, the new selected Executive Board should have a passion for belly dance and sharing this beautiful art form with others. This member should exude a strong passion for the club and belly dance as an art. They should add to and maintain the club’s atmosphere of friendship and respect.

IV. General Board/ Executive Board Member and General Body Member Removal:
A.  Any officer who displays a lack in responsibility in their position or violates the contract of UBDC should be given a written formal warning by the President. Should the behavior persist after a written warning, the President will call a board meeting and the group will discuss and vote on the status of the board member. Any board member who puts the safety of another board member or general body member in jeopardy will lose their board position and/or UBDC membership if there is proof of the incident. If the President violates the UBDC contract, the Vice-President is eligible to give them a written formal warning or call a board meeting to discuss their standing if the behavior persists. If the Vice-President and President are in violation, any board member may contact the UBDC adviser to discuss the situation. 
B. If the board member in question has never received a written warning, but has behaved in a way that warrants a meeting about their status, the board must unanimously agree to remove them from their position. If the member has received one or more written warnings, one more than half of the board must agree to remove them from their position. If the group cannot make a decision, the member in question will state their case to the group's adviser who will make the final decision.
C. General body members who behave in any manner that violates the contract of UBDC or puts the safety of a member of UBDC in jeopardy will immediately have their status as a member be discussed by the board. The board will vote on their membership status if there is proof of the incident.  If the group cannot make a decision, the member in question will state their case to the group's adviser who will make the final decision.

V. Resolving Disputes

If anyone on the board witnesses repeated behavior that makes other members uncomfortable or that disrupts the club, every board member has the right to ask any	member to engage in a private conversation about the behavior either before, during or after the club meeting in the most polite and discreet manner possible. This is to prevent further disruptions, address strife head on and prevent disputes in the future.
If a member feels they are being disrespected or feels uncomfortable, they should go directly to one of the board members as soon as possible who will then bring the issue to the President.  It will be dealt with as the general board sees fit. If the issue involves the behavior of the President, the board may call a meeting and/or contact the club’s adviser if necessary.  
Any board member is allowed to contact the club’s adviser at any time for any reason. 
Mediated meetings among members or board members with an adviser or the head of SAI may be called by the President or any other board member at any time that they see fit.
The President with the assistance of the Executive Board if necessary, will mediate disputes between all members including board members. Should the need arise, a representative from SAI or adviser may mediate. 
Should the President be involved in a dispute, or should any party not be satisfied with the result of the President's mediation, any party may request that the RSO adviser shall mediate. The results of mediated conversations with the adviser shall be final.
If the issue does not pertain to UBDC or belly dance, the President and the board if necessary should suggest resources and work with the UBDC adviser to suggest the best solution.

The mission of the UMass Belly Dance Club is to teach and perform the beautiful and ancient art of belly dance at the University of Massachusetts Amherst. UBDC’s goal is to inspire and empower students to celebrate and love their bodies regardless of size, age, gender, race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, or ability; thus raising self esteem and promoting a community of acceptance. UBDC’s passion is to share these goals, values, and talents with the UMass Amherst community.

All members of the UMass Belly Dance Club are entitled to freedom of speech and will not under any circumstances be deprived of the opportunity to share their opinion with the group.

Under no circumstances will a member or potential member of the UMass Belly Dance Club be discriminated against due to race, ethnicity, gender, age, orientation, religion or other factors.

I. Membership
A. Undergraduate and graduate students at the University of Massachusetts Amherst are eligible to be members of UBDC. Five college (Amherst College, Mt. Holyoke College, Hampshire College and Smith College) students are also eligible to be members of UBDC, but they must pay to use the recreation center.
B. Membership shall be established after a prospective member signs the club contract and pays dues. Prospective members will then be added to the Campus Pulse roster and will remain active members if they attend weekly meetings.  For liability and safety concerns, as well as according to SAI regulations, members who do not sign the contract or pay dues will be unable to participate in club practices or performances.
C. Dues:
$5 dues will be collected by the Treasurer at the beginning of every new semester to aid with the cost of props and prop repair, event planning costs, costume costs for those with financial issues, etc. They are to be in a sealed envelope with the member's name and email written on it with exact change inside.
Any member who expresses financial issues to the President or Treasurer will be exempt from paying dues on a case to case basis.
Any five college or graduate student who has to pay to use the recreation center does not have to pay dues.
D. Club Contract: The UBDC member contract should be enforced by the general board and followed at all times by every member. It should be given to every new member at the start of each semester and kept on file by the President for returning members until they graduate or leave UBDC. The President is responsible for the collection and distribution of the contract. They should later input all names into a google document to keep track of who has signed it. The contract will be reviewed by the board who will decide to make changes if necessary at the start of every semester.

The contract is as follows: UMass Belly Dance Club Member Contract

As a member of UBDC, I hereby agree to read, understand and follow the rules set forth in our group’s contract in order to be an official member of UBDC. To be in good standing a member must: attend practices regularly, pay dues, complete forms, participate in events when available, assist with fundraising as well as treat the UBDC leadership board and all fellow members with respect and kindness.

To be considered an official member that can attend UBDC practices and perform, members must pay dues and attend practices regularly at the beginning of each semester. Financial issues should be brought to the attention of the President or Treasurer who will assist should the need arise. All paper work and dues need to be turned in within the time frame that the President and Treasurer will announce at the beginning of the semester. They are to be in a sealed envelope with exact change inside. The front of the envelope should include the member's name and email.  An inability to pay dues on time will result in a meeting with the Treasurer to discuss financial situations or an inability to attend practices/events. Members will then be invited to the Campus Pulse roster via email and need to accept to complete membership.

2. UBDC’s members will be informed of performance opportunities as they arise. All members are expected to answer polls, posts or emails regarding availability for performing in a timely manner. Performing is always optional. At performances, members are expected to arrive on time and behave in a manner that is respectful to the club and belly dance as an art. Members should not wear UBDC costumes anywhere other than the performance stage (for example, in a dining common while getting dinner after a show). Walking around in costume before or after events without a form of cover up is not permitted. Examples of exceptions include: tabling at the activities expo or taking a picture with friends after a show. 

3. Members are expected to turn in any payments for costumes/coin belts on time by the deadline set by the UBDC board. Shaker/coin belt payments should be in a sealed envelope in exact change. The envelope should include your name, email, the number of shakers you want and the colors.  Costumes are ordered by every performer individually and you must do it within a timely manner to be able to perform and avoid shipping issues. Again, should financial or ordering issues occur, contact a board member for assistance. Never let cost keep you from performing!
 
4. UBDC members are expected to be accepting and respectful of all races, ethnicities, religions, classes, gender orientations, and identities.  If a member of UBDC violates the atmosphere of mutual respect in any manner at any time or place, (whether at meetings, events or via social media, etc), their standing will be discussed by the UBDC Board and depending of the severity of the case may receive a formal warning, or if necessary may not remain a member of the club.

5. UBDC is not responsible for the individual actions and decisions of members at events that are not club-sponsored. This includes, but is not limited to social events (parties), professional belly dance gigs, and outside practices led by members and not UBDC instructors (President, VP and Secretary). Any UBDC member who performs professionally at an event that is not sponsored by UBDC is expected to perform as an individual under their own name and not as a member of UBDC.

In closing, our members uphold the mission of the UMass Belly Dance Club which is to teach and perform the beautiful and ancient art of belly dance at the University of Massachusetts Amherst. UBDC’s goal is to inspire and empower students to celebrate and love their bodies regardless of size, age, gender, race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, or ability; thus raising self esteem and promoting a community of acceptance. UBDC’s passion is to share these goals, values, and talents with the UMass Amherst community.

Printed Name:                                                     Signature and Date:

II. Meetings/Rehearsals

Active members are highly encouraged to attend weekly UBDC general body meetings to learn choreography and rehearse as a group.. If a member intends to perform, weekly rehearsals are mandatory. Rehearsals and meetings are for the purpose of warming up, teaching choreography and technique, practicing, and/or event planning. 

B. Meetings/Rehearsals will be instructed and led by the President, Vice-President and Secretary. 

III. The UBDC Board:

Bi- weekly board meetings will be attended by all of the following board members for the purposes of planning. Board meetings may be held on a weekly basis if necessary (festival/event planning etc).

A. The Executive Board of UBDC shall be:

President: 
-They are the Chief Executive Officer of the RSO. 
-They are responsible for all aspects of the functioning of the group and must have Signature Responsibility and attend activation training yearly. 
- The President is responsible for being the primary contact of the group and booking performances for UBDC.
- They will monitor the campus pulse roster. 
-They are in charge of running all meetings and must facilitate our board meetings. They must also create surveys to decide on bi-weekly meeting times for the general board.
-They are responsible for reserving our space, time, and day at the Rec Center and are responsible for all meetings on the behalf of UBDC. 
-The President will be responsible for creating and teaching choreography for performances along with the help of the Vice President and Secretary. 
-They will oversee all aspects of the groups functioning including, but not limited to: event planning, costume ordering, social media, publicity, finances, fundraising and will be responsible for working on any difficulties within the group that may arise. 
-Finally, the President is responsible for writing the constitution and maintaining it throughout their time in their position. They are required to show it to the general board during a board meeting before the spring semester ends to get all input and approval on matters and make changes if necessary. If five or members agree that a point needs to be edited or deleted, it will be done. If the group cannot come to a unanimous decision, the adviser of the group will have the final say.

Vice President: 
-They are  the second in command of the RSO. 
-They are eligible to attend activation training as a representative from UBDC.
-The Vice President shall take over duties for the President when they are not present and will also assist the President in all duties related to the  functioning of UBDC. 
-They will assist in teaching weekly classes/meetings and with creating choreography.

Secretary:  
-They shall be responsible for maintaining all records for the RSO including documents relevant to the functioning of the group. These records shall, in all possible cases, be collected electronically and shall be passed on from the current to the future Secretary during the transition period. 
-The Secretary shall record minutes at all official group-planning meetings with club committees. 
-The Secretary shall record attendance when necessary and minutes at all board meetings. 
--They are eligible to attend activation training as a representative from UBDC.
-They will assist in teaching weekly classes/meetings and with choreography.

Treasurer: 
-The Treasurer shall be the Chief Financial Officer of the RSO. 
-They will be responsible for maintaining the group’s finances and for all fundraising initiatives including the publicity and organization of them. 
-They will be responsible for submitting an annual budget request to the SGA with the help of the President 
-They will be responsible for the collection and recording of dues and any other club payments.  
-They will  be required to have Signature Responsibility.
-They will be required to inform UBDC members what UBDC will intend to spend in the current academic year, what members should expect to spend on costumes/apparel and what we will do with dues/ money donated to the club.

B. The General Board shall include the Executive Board and:
1-2 Event Coordinators: 
-They will assist the President with all event planning; including but not limited to invitations,  decoration, set up/break down, catering, AV, lighting, thank you notes/emails, booking photographers/videographers, assisting the Publicist(s) with advertising, etc. 
-They are expected to attend weekly board meetings (on time) and be active, undergraduate members of UBDC.
1-2 Costume Coordinators: 
-They will assist the Executive Board in choosing the semester's costumes
-Tthey will assist members with ordering/delivery and are responsible for getting order links to all members
-They will troubleshoot should issues arise with ordering costume pieces and be the point of contact between UBDC and our costume sellers.
- They will also design the UBDC gear/apparel to be ordered each spring semester. 
-They are expected to attend weekly board meetings (on time) and be active, undergraduate members of UBDC.
1 Publicist: 
-They oversee all UBDC advertising and assist the e-board with social media representation.  
-Their social media duties include: creating facebook events/advertising, tweeting, posting photos/statuses (which is to be done by the publicist and the eboard only). 
-They will assist the Event Coordinator(s) with all event advertising.
-They are expected to be in communication with the President about posting and mindful of what they post. -Passwords are to be shared among the publicist and President only.  
-They are expected to attend weekly board meetings (on time) and be active, undergraduate members of UBDC.

*The e-board will be the only administrators on the UBDC facebook fan page and in the UBDC member private group. Administrators must be UMass students who are active members of UBDC. 

C. Election of Board Members: 

-UBDC board members are permitted to fill their position for as long as they like until their graduation date provided that they complete their duties completely and efficiently. 

-If a board member wishes to fill their position for longer than one year, they must present their reasoning to the board who will vote on their extended position time. If another member wishes to run for the position after one year, the current board member holding the position may (with the board’s permission after the vote) run against them for the retention of their position.

-Any officer who completes their duties efficiently may remain in their position for another year if no other member wants to run for the position. 

-New officers should be elected in the spring after spring break to ensure enough time to train under the current officers until they leave the position. New officers are officially in their position after the last day of classes during the Spring semester.

1. The required traits for all UBDC board members are as follows:
      -Warm, welcoming and outgoing personality.
     -Dedication to the club is a MUST. This member must have shown dedication by coming to 
     meetings every week on time, performing often, volunteering, assisting in fundraising efforts, etc.
-Public speaking skills: this will be crucial when it comes to teaching the group. Board members should be comfortable speaking in front of a large group of people.  Teachers: (President, VP and Secretary) should be comfortable dancing, teaching, improving and performing in front of large groups.
-Mature, responsible and trustworthy. 
-Timely and organized: Board members must be dedicated enough to take on the responsibility of helping to run UBDC and be able to balance these responsibilities with other aspects of student life.

Everyone who embodies these qualities is eligible for a leadership position: UBDC will never be biased against different gender identities, body types, class, race/ethnicity, backgrounds, etc.

2. For the election of general board members and the Treasurer position: The President will inform the general body of UBDC if there will be any vacancies for the next semester. They will then compile a list of the members who are interested in the position. The entire board will then meet with those on the list who will give a two minute presentation at a board meeting stating why they want to be considered for the position and why they think they would be the best candidate (if for any reason a candidate cannot meet for the presentation process, they may submit their statement in writing).

The board will later discuss and decide if the candidates are eligible and offer positions to the most dedicated, well-rounded candidate. This discussion will take place when the candidates are not present. An anonymous vote to be tallied by the President will determine the next elected board members. The President will inform all candidates of the outcome via email. If a current board member is leaving their position and wants to apply for a new one, they must go through the same presentation process and will not be eligible for the discussion and selection of that position. 

3.. For the election of a new Secretary, Vice-President or President: 
The current President will inform the members of UBDC if there will be any vacancies for the next semester. They will compile a list of the members who are interested in the position. 

-Candidates must give a two minute verbal presentation to the entire board stating why they want to be considered for the position and why they think they would be the best candidate. 
-They must teach the general board a short choreography for ten minutes and answer all questions that board members ask during and after the lesson. 
- Finally, candidates must perform a two minute solo in front of the general board. 

After a final question and answer session the entire board will meet to discuss the candidates and who will fill each position; they will participate in a vote tallied by the President which will determine the next elected board members. The President will inform all candidates of the outcome via email.


Along with the required traits for all UBDC officers: anyone who is applying for teaching positions within UBDC (Secretary, Vice President and President) must have the following qualities:

-They must be consistently present and on time to all general body meetings, performances, and board meetings if applicable.
-They should be able to display an ability to choreograph versatile dance pieces by participating actively in UBDC meetings/performances, researching belly dance and its numerous techniques and styles and by taking extra classes (such as belly dance group fit classes at the rec-center).
-They must display an ability to balance teaching,choreographing, attending meetings (general body, board, SAI, RSO adviser, SAI trainings, etc) and leading UBDC.
-They must show an ability to handle stressful situations and adversity should difficulties within UBDC arise.
-They must have performed a solo (prior to the election process) that is their original choreographed work and at least two minutes in length. To count, the solo must be performed at a UBDC sponsored event (ie our Festival) or at an event UBDC has been invited to perform for. Events that have audiences made up of only UBDC members (such as our Hafla) do not count.

*UBDC teachers do not have to be certified belly dance instructors.
Most importantly, the new selected President, Vice President or Secretary should have a passion for belly dance and sharing this beautiful art form with others. This member should love UBDC with all of their heart and should be able to maintain the club’s friendly feel.

IV. General Board/ Executive Board Member and General Body Member Removal:
A.  Any officer who displays a lack in responsibility in their position or violates the contract of UBDC should be given a written formal warning by the President. Should the behavior persist after a written warning, the President will call a board meeting and the group will discuss and vote on the status of the board member. Any board member who puts the safety of another board member or general body member in jeopardy will lose their board position and/or UBDC membership if there is proof of the incident.
B. If the board member in question has never received a written warning, but has behaved in a way that warrants a meeting about their status, the board must unanimously agree to remove them from their position. If the member has received one or more written warnings, one more than half of the board must agree to remove them from their position. If the group cannot make a decision, the member in question will state their case to the group's adviser who will make the final decision.
C. General body members who behave in any manner that violates the contract of UBDC or puts the safety of a member of UBDC in jeopardy will immediately have their status as a member be discussed by the board who will vote on their membership status if there is proof of the incident.  If the group cannot make a decision, the member in question will state their case to the group's adviser who will make the final decision.

V. Resolving Disputes

-If anyone on the board witnesses repeated behavior that makes other members uncomfortable or that disrupts the club, every board member has the right to ask any	member to engage in a private conversation about the behavior either before, during or after the club meeting in the most polite and discreet manner possible. This is to prevent further disruptions, address strife head on and prevent blow ups in the future.

-If a member feels they are being disrespected or feels uncomfortable, they should go directly  to one of the board members as soon as possible who will then bring the issue to the President.  It will be dealt with as the President sees fit. If the issues involves the behavior of the President, the board may call a meeting and/or contact the club’s adviser if necessary.

-Mediated meetings among members or board members with an adviser or the head of SAI may be called by the President at any time that they see fit.

-The President should mediate disputes between all members or board members if a mediated conversation with a representative from SAI is not necessary. If the issue has nothing to do with UBDC or belly dance, the President should suggest resources and work with their adviser to suggest the best solution.

- Should the President be involved in a dispute, or should any party not be satisfied with the result of the President's mediation, any party may request that the RSO adviser shall	mediate. The results of mediated conversations with the advisor shall be final.
