Constitution of the University of Massachusetts Dhadak Fusion Dance Team.pdf
DocsList.Data:
Constitution of the University of Massachusetts Dhadak Fusion Dance Team 

 Article I: Name 

 The name of this Registered Student Organization shall be University of Massachusetts 
 Dhadak Fusion Dance Team. 

 Article II: Objectives 

 Section 1 

 UMASS Dhadak will promote cultural diversity through different dance styles at UMASS 
 Amherst, as well as the local Amherst community.  The dance styles include Bollywood, 
 Bhangra, Bharatnatyam (classical Indian dance), Kuthu, Raas, Lyrical, Contemporary, 
 Ballet, Jazz, Hip-Hop, and Salsa. 

 Section 2 

 The team will perform and represent UMASS while participating in competitions 
 against other dance teams around the U.S.  The team will also perform for any UMASS 
 official events and provide dance lessons for the UMASS Amherst community. 

 Article III: The Executive Board 

 Section 1 

 The Executive Board shall consist of the President, Vice President, Treasurer, Outreach 
 Officer, Public Relations, and Event Coordinator. The positions of Public Relations and 
 Event Coordinator may be held by a single member if deemed appropriate by the rest of 
 the Executive Board. 

 Section 2 

 All Executive Board members have the right to call a meeting. 

 Section 3 

 The Executive Board will be elected by active team members. The newly appointed 
 officers must have been on the team for at least one year, and the newly appointed 
 President must have been on the Executive Board for at least one semester.  

 Section 4 

 There will be an orientation process for all newly elected Officials by the current 

  Officers.  During this period the current Officers shall cover the roles and duties of each 
 new Officer as well as explain any details pertaining to each Officer’s role that needs 
 more attention.  After the orientation process, the newly elected Officers will take hold 
 of the Office and perform their duties.   

 Article IV: Officers 

 Section 1 

 The Board Members’ duties shall be outlined.  The Board members must attend all 
 practices and meetings. 

 Section 2: The President 

 The President shall be responsible for the following: 

 One of the co-captains 
 Organize and file appropriate documents for all Team-sponsored activities in 
 conjunction with the Treasurer 
 Organize the contract with the Rec Center in conjunction with the Treasurer 
 Organize all practices 
 In charge of overseeing and designating responsibility to the officers 
 Communicates with the Vice President, Treasurer, Secretary, and Event Coordinator for 
 all event planning 
 Help the Team prepare fully for competitions and performances 
 Promote and encourage a welcoming, supportive, and cohesive team atmosphere 
 Plan at least one Team bonding event each semester 
 Check the email account daily and respond to all necessary emails 
 Be in touch with competitions and outside event directors 

 Section 3: Vice President 

 The Vice President will be responsible for the following: 

 One of the co-captains 
 Holds signature responsibility  
 If the President relinquishes his/her position for any reason, the Vice President will take 
 over the duties of the President until a new official is elected 
 If any Board member is unable to perform their duties for a serious reason, the Vice 
 President will oversee that member’s position until they are able to resume duties 
 Will be the President’s go-to person for any additional aid necessary in the coordination 
 of planning and events between the President, Treasurer, Public Relations, and Event 
 Coordinator 
 Promote and encourage a welcoming, supportive, and cohesive team atmosphere 
 Plan at least one Team bonding event each semester 

  Must enforce all contract rules 
 Help the Team prepare fully for competitions and performances 
 Will be the time-keeper at practices 

 Section 4: Treasurer 

 The Treasurer shall be responsible for the following: 

 Will hold signature responsibility 
 Will write up grant proposals and have them approved by the Advisor 
 Will plan and coordinate fundraisers with E-Board members 
 Responsible for diligent maintenance of team accounts 
 Primary person in filling out team budget requests from SGA 
 Involved with financial planning and budgeting for performance events and/or 
 competitions in conjunction with the E-Board members 

 Section 5: The Outreach Officer 

 The Outreach Officer shall be responsible for the following: 

 Create and distribute information slips for audition candidates 
 Maintain a copy of the Constitution, the Team Member Contract, all Team records, and 
 the various RSO and SGA rules and regulations that pertain to the team 
 Record minutes of each Executive Board meeting and upload copies on the team Gmail 
 account 
 Work in conjunction with Public Relations for promotional events such as 
 advertisements and performances 
 Coordinate transportation and housing for competitions when necessary 
 Maintain communication with SASA and other organizations to promote our events 
 Maintain an active Team member list, including phone numbers and email addresses 

 Section 6: Public Relations/Event Coordinator 

 Public Relations and the Event Coordinator shall be responsible for: 

 Public relations of all dance activities 
 Raise awareness of UMASS Dhadak to the Five College Area and surrounding 
 community members 
 Advertise events through flyers, advertisements, and table promotions in the Campus 
 Center Concourse 
 Contact TIX Unlimited to reserve tables 
 Organize and delegate responsibilities for the distribution of promotional materials 
 Work in conjunction with the Outreach Officer and Treasurer for promotional events 
 such as raffles, advertisements, etc. 

  Work in conjunction with the E-Board to effectively promote and plan performances 
 and/or competitions 
 Will be responsible for promotional Team equipment such as the Team banner, T-shirts 
 to be sold, poster boards, excess flyers, etc. 

 Section 7: The Media Officer 

 The Media Officer shall be responsible for the following: 

 Creating the song mixes, editing performance videos, managing the YouTube account 
 for the team 
 Work in conjunction with Public Relations to edit online videos and content 

 Section 8: The Production Chair 

 The Production Chair shall be responsible for the following: 

 Production Chair will be responsible for the inventory and storage of all costumes and 
 props 
 Confirm that team members have their costumes leading up to a performance 
 Work in conjunction with the Treasurer to purchase costumes and props 

 Article V: Membership to Team 

 Section 1 

 Each Team member must be an Undergraduate student at UMASS Amherst.  Entrance 
 to the Team is by audition only.  Auditions are held once at the beginning of each 
 semester.  If there are many returning team members, auditions may not be held.  In 
 cases of special circumstances (e.g. a student wishes to join the Team but has missed the 
 formal audition or a student takes a leave of absence with the intention of returning to 
 the team), admissions to the team are at the discretion of the Board.  UMASS Dhadak 
 Fusion Dance Team is not limited to just having members on the team.  There can be 
 members of the RSO who are interested in the same goals and can participate in 
 fundraisers, community service, etc.   

 Section 2 

 Possible fees as a Team member can include costs for team jackets, competition fees, 
 uniforms, and travel expenses. 

 Section 3 

  Team dancers must sign the Team Contract, which denotes their responsibilities and 
 commitments to the team.  This includes being an active competitor and active 
 participant in at least 95% of Team practices, which will be held 2-4 times a week, as 
 stipulated in the Team Contract.  Team members are also responsible for attending at 
 least 75% of community service events.  The President shall maintain a list of active 
 members who attend Team meetings, and members who repeatedly fail to attend 
 meetings will be dealt with at the discretion of the E-Board.  Exceptions may be made in 
 the case of academic conflict or extenuating circumstances such as illness.  Repeated 
 failure of a Team member to adhere to practice attendance policy may result in the 
 Co-Captains bringing the issue to the E-Board, who will then vote on whether his or her 
 membership to the team should be terminated.  Possible dispensations for missing 
 practices can be made at the discretion of the Co-Captains, in the case of injury.  
 Team members that are not a part of the dance team must attend all general body 
 meetings as well as 75% of dance team events, performances, and/or community 
 service. If a team member cannot attend a meeting or event he/she must notify one of 
 the co-captains at least a day in advance. 

 Section 4 

 Team members will maintain the utmost level of respect for other members and all 
 members of the Board.  This includes personal hygiene, language used, appropriate 
 body contact, etc.  If inappropriate behavior is seen during any team sanctioned events 
 it is up to the E-Board to discuss the situation.  The Team is not liable for any 
 inappropriate contact and behavior outside of team-sanctioned events. 

 Section 5 

 If a Team member fails to meet any of the above criteria, it is at the discretion of the 
 E-Board to evaluate and possibly terminate his/her membership to the team.   

 Article VI: Voting 

 Section 1 

 All active team members are eligible to vote.  Candidates for callbacks, new team 
 members, and E-Board elections will be decided by current team members after a 
 consensus is reached.   

 Section 2 

 The presence of a quorum shall be sufficient for voting on a motion.  A quorum is 
 defined as 50% +1 of all present active voting members at the time when the motion is 
 presented or a special election is held.  

 Section 3 

  A motion shall be deemed passed or a person placed on the team, if majorities, i.e. 50% 
 +1 of the votes cast are affirmative.   

 Section 4 

 The appointing of all Officers shall incur a month before the end of the spring semester. 

 Section 5 

 In the case of a vacancy occurring in any of the offices of the Team, an election will be 
 held to fill that office.   

 Section 6 

 If a Board member fails to perform their duties and their actions are affecting the 
 process of Team meetings, functions, or both, then steps for resignation or 
 impeachment will be taken.  Before team involvement, the Board will meet with the 
 member in question and discuss a resignation.  If the member refuses to resign, a Team 
 meeting will be called for the impeachment of that board member.  All present, voting 
 Team members must be fully informed of the reasons why the proposed impeachment is 
 occurring.  If 50% +1 of all team members present at that meeting vote in favor of a 
 change in the board member's position, then there shall be an impeachment.  The votes 
 will be cast in a close ballot and another E-Board member will count the ballots and 
 announce the results.  If the team decides on impeachment, then there will be a special 
 nomination and election process to fill the vacancy.  During the time of the vacancy, the 
 Vice President will assume the duties of the vacant position until the position is filled. 

 Article VII: Procedures of a Meeting 

 Section 1: Board Meetings 

 Meetings are to be held at least once a month, throughout the school year, at times set 
 by the board.  Additional meetings may be held each month if the board so desires.  
 Quorum for a meeting will be a majority of the officers, 50% +1. 

 Section 2: Procedures for a Board Meeting 

 Procedures are as follows: 
 Outreach Officer reads minutes from previous meetings and notes any new topics to be 
 discussed in the current meeting 
 Treasurer reads a report of all transactions and gives account balances since the 
 previous meeting 
 Business is discussed.  All members are welcome to share and discuss dance team 

  matters 
 By a notion to whomever called the meeting and upon a vote of the remainder of the 
 board, the meeting is adjourned 

 Section 3: Team Practices 

 Team practices are held 2-4 times a week.   

 Section 4: Events 

 Events include Team performances given at a variety of venues, as well as competitions.  
 Events shall be planned, funded, and executed by the President, Vice President, 
 Treasurer, and Event Coordinator.  Each Team member is required to practice in 
 fundraising for these events, as well as the actual events.   

 Article IX: Equipment 

 Section 1 

 The modification and/or repaid of purchased equipment and the purchase of new 
 equipment shall be decide upon by a vote of the Board.  

 Section 2 

 The cost and repaid of the damaged equipment will be borne by the Team Treasury.  
 However, if the majority vote of the E-Board determines that the damage resulted from 
 an individual’s negligence, he/she will be required to pay for its repair.  Any equipment 
 not returned at the end of the scheduled use will be charged to the member who took it 
 on loan.  All equipment on loan should be returned in the same condition it was lent. 

 Section 3 

 A Team equipment inventory will be taken at the beginning and end of each semester.  
 At this time, the Board will make the appropriate adjustment in the equipment 
 inventory records.   

 Article X: Amendments and Articles 

 Section 1 

 Amendments to this constitution can be made at any time by the affirmative vote of a 
 majority (50% +1) of a quorum of the entire Board. 

 Section 2 

  Articles can be added to this constitution at any time by the affirmative vote of a 
 majority (50% +1) of a quorum of the entire Board. 

 Article XI: Distribution 

 Section 1 

 A copy of this Constitution will be given to each member of the Board.  A permanent 
 copy of the Constitution and all signed Team Member Contracts will be maintained by 
 the Secretary for any Team member to view.  The Constitution and a Team Contract will 
 be e-mailed to each active Team member at the beginning of each semester.  
 Additionally, there will be a current copy of the Constitution posted for any Team 
 member to view on the Campus Pulse website. 

 Amended on 05/12/2024

Constitution of the Disability Culture Club 

Article 1. Mission Statement. 

i. Description. 

The mission and goals of the Disability Culture Club are as follows: 

1. To build cultural awareness, acceptance, and inclusion of the disability community at 

UMass; and 

2. To foster a sense of community strength among all those on-campus who identify as 

disabled or as having a disability. 

ii. Activities. 

The activities and events we intend to host in order to accomplish these goals include: 

● Invitation of notable disability rights activists to speak on campus; 
● Hosting of regular movie nights to enjoy discussions in a disability-friendly space; 
● Hosting of a disability cultural online community for discussion and memes; 
● Hosting of social events to commemorate important dates in disability history; 
● Hosting of a Disability Pride Week; 
● And regular meetings every Saturday. 

iii. Philosophy. 

At the Disability Culture Club, we believe in the importance of disability as a facet of diversity, 
and the importance of diversity as a foundation for a strong and innovative society. 

iv. Strategic Plan. 

In the next five years, the Disability Culture Club aims to focus first on building a strong 
community, and then on outreach to the larger UMass community. That means our rough goals 
for each year are as follows: 

1. Year 1 

: Building a Base: 
(2019-2020)
​
outreach tasks, to spread community awareness of our club. 

focusing on recruitment, social media, and 

2. Year 2 

: Establishing Core Events: 
(2020-2021)
​

focusing on laying the groundwork for 

our yearly core events (such as Disability Pride Week), and establishing a foundation 
that future board members can build upon. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
​
​
​
​
 3. Year 3 

: Collaboration and Intersectionality: 
(2021-2022)
​

focusing on communicating 

and co-hosting events with other student groups on-campus, and on emphasizing the 
intersectional nature of disability identity. 

4. Year 4 

: Community Outreach: 
(2022-2023)
​

focusing on providing fun and informative 

events to educate the UMass community at large about disability history, disability 
culture, and our club. 

5. Year 5 

: Public Service: 
(2023-2024)
​

long-term resources on disability history and disability culture. 

focusing on providing the UMass community with 

Article 2. Membership. 

Membership is open to all students in the Five College community, without regard to race, color, 
age, national origin, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, political 
beliefs, reprisal or retaliation for prior civil rights activity, marital status, family/parental status, 
public assistance status, veteran status, or dis/ability status. 

Voting membership is extended towards all those with an expressed interest in the club. This 
may mean showing up to at least one of the semester meetings, communicating with the club 
members in some way online during the semester, or otherwise on a case-by-case basis. 

Article 3. Meetings. 

There shall be a General Meeting every Saturday for all members of the club.  

These meetings are two hours long and split into two hour-long segments. One hour-long 
segment of each meeting is dedicated to social activities, such as board games and 
conversation; the other hour-long segment is dedicated to planning and discussing future club 
events. General Meetings are chaired by the President, or by the Vice President if the President 
is unable.  

Any decisions that have to be made by the club will be discussed in at least one General 
Meeting before a decision is taken. At least one email will be sent to the entire membership to 
solicit feedback and opinions from all members, and a period of at least one week will take 
place between when this email is sent and when a decision is made. The decision ultimately 
taken will be decided by a two-thirds majority vote by the membership base. 

Board members may also elect to call for a Board Meeting at any time, with the agreement of all 
other board members. A Board Meeting will not be held unless it is at a time when all board 
members are able to attend. Board Meetings will be held for the purpose of communicating 
about current club projects, current board member responsibilities, and updates on club-related 
activities. Board Meetings may be held in-person or online. 

Article 4. Executive Board/Officer Positions. 

​
​
​
​
​
​
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 i. Position Descriptions. 

The executive board positions are as follows: 

President: 

Duties include: Planning and overseeing meetings; heading member recruitment efforts; 
maintaining the website; assisting with the management of social media branches of the club; 
overseeing the delegation of duties to all other board positions 

The President will have signature responsibility. 

Vice President: 

Duties include: Communicating with the general membership; assisting in member recruitment 
efforts; managing social media branches of the club; taking on duties delegated by the president 

Secretary: 

Duties include: Holding elections, amendment votes, and other general votes; keeping meeting 
notes; keeping records on meetings and elections; communicating with the SGA and other 
members of the outside campus community 

Treasurer: 

Duties include: Managing all finances; communicating with the SGA for budgeting issues 

The Treasurer will have signature responsibility. 

ii. Powers, Responsibilities, and Terms. 

All executive board members have the following powers: 

● The ability to call for a Board Meeting; 
● The ability to make reservations or communicate with other groups under the name of 

the club, for activities strictly related to the club; 
● Moderator status on the online forum of the DCC; 
● And access to the social media of the DCC. 

Two executive board members will have signature responsibility: the President and the 
Treasurer. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Executive board members will hold their position for a term of one academic year. At the end of 
this academic year, they may apply for election again. 

iii. Signature Responsibility. 

The President and Treasurer will both have signature responsibility. 

Article 5. The Election Procedure. 

i. How Records Will Be Kept. 

Records on every election will be kept by the Secretary. They will be saved on the Disability 
Culture Club’s shared Google Drive, and given a title that indicates the year of the election. 
These notes will include: a record of all who applied for an executive board position that year, a 
record of how many votes were tallied for each candidate, and statements by the newly-elected 
board members on their plans for the following year. 

ii. Election Timeline. 

Elections for all executive board positions will be held once yearly during the month of March. 
Elections will be announced no later than the first week of March, and new officers will be 
chosen no later than the last week of March. Votes will be collected online, using email or 
Google Form submission; accommodations will be made to collect votes from anyone who is 
unable to submit their vote through one of these two methods. 

iii. Special Elections. 

Special elections may be held in the event of an officer vacancy. A special election will be 
announced by email to the entire membership of the club; members will be encouraged at this 
time to express their interest if they want to take the position.  

After at least two weeks has passed, an additional email will be sent out to inform the 
membership of all candidates for the vacant officer position. This will be considered the start of 
the voting phase. Members may submit votes online by email or Google Form submission; 
accommodations will be made to collect votes from anyone who is unable to submit their vote 
through one of these two methods. 

After such a voting period of at least one week, a final email will be sent out to announce the 
results and inform the membership of the new officer. The new officer will be expected to 
present their plans for the year at the next weekly meeting. 

iv. Removal of Officers and/or Members. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Under exceptional circumstances, an officer or member may have their officer position or 
membership revoked. This process will involve, first, notification of the officer or member in 
question. The officer or member will be given an opportunity to address the membership at 
large, and a vote will be held online on the possible removal of the officer or member. An officer 
or member will only be removed with a two-thirds majority vote.  

Article 6. Statement of Free Speech and Expression. 

The Disability Culture Club values the diversity of experience that each member of the 
community can bring. To that end, we are committed to protecting the free and open exchange 
of ideas and opinions, and will take every step to ensure it is always possible within our walls. 
We believe that free speech and expression are at the heart of a productive and creative 
society, and we shall not allow a member’s freedom of speech or expression to be infringed 
upon under any circumstances. 

Article 7. Statement of Non-discrimination. 

The Disability Culture Club welcomes anyone who has any interest in our ideals, regardless of 
race, color, age, national origin, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, 
political beliefs, reprisal or retaliation for prior civil rights activity, marital status, family/parental 
status, public assistance status, veteran status, or dis/ability status. 

Article 8. Policies for Amendment of Constitution. 

Any member may suggest an amendment to this constitution by submitting it in writing to the 
President or Vice President. All members will be informed about proposed amendments through 
email or other electronic communication, and a vote on the amendment will be held at least one 
week after the initial communication. If the amendment passes a two-thirds majority vote, it will 
be submitted to the Secretary of the Registry for approval. Upon approval by the Secretary of 
the Registry, the amendment will become part of the constitution. 

Chronological records of each amendment to the constitution will be kept by the Secretary. 
These will be saved on the Disability Culture Club’s shared Google Drive.

DocsList.Name: ESportsClubCharter 2016-2017.docx
DocsList.Data:
ESports Club Charter
Mission Statement
The University of Massachusetts ESports club seeks to promote community within the UMass Student Body through the organization of forums, tournaments, events, gatherings and other functions centered around electronic sports. We seek to gather interested students for LAN events, in-Houses, and other social experiences involving ESports.

Statement of Free Speech and Non-Discrimination
The ESports being highly community driven will not tolerate an atmosphere in which any of its members believe themselves to have been threatened, discriminated against or in any way oppressed. This includes but is not limited to, any form of removal of Free Speech and its implied powers, discrimination based upon race, religion, champion preference, solo queue mentalities as well as its other variations. Furthermore we adhere to Riot’s in-game policies regarding toxicity and expect these to be followed by our members both on and off the rift.
_______________________________________________________________________
Section 1
(Membership)
All students at the University of Massachusetts Amherst shall be eligible to be members of the ESports Club
Voting privileges shall be reserved to University of Massachusetts Amherst students
Membership shall be provided to all eligible persons who request membership through our online application process
Additionally, eligible persons must attend at least four meetings or community oriented events to be granted membership after having notified an officer of intent
By applying to be a member of the ESports Club, the club is granted license to record and use any and all types of video or photography that you may be present in during club meetings, including camera recordings, live-stream broadcasts, and captured gameplay footage.
Partial membership may be requested by alumni and the general public for the purpose of participating in events and activities hosted by the club
Partial membership does not grant voting rights
Active members that have monthly attendance over 75% will be eligible for membership rewards


Section 2
(Resolving Disputes)
Disputes arising between members on matters of RSO policy shall be dealt with through majority votes of the general membership.
Disputes arising between members on other matters shall be dealt with through mediation.
Mediation consists of a meeting involving both parties and a mediator with the purpose of coming to a solution and putting the issue to rest
The President shall mediate disputes between members
Should the President be involved in the dispute, or should either party not be satisfied by the result of the mediation, any party may request that all officers be mediators for the conflict. 
Should the conflict involve the legal issues the officer or member will contact the appropriate officials. 



Section 3
(Officers)
Officers serve for a one year period, active following the final day of classes during the spring semester
Officers must attend 50% of weekly meetings.
Club leadership shall consist of 5 club officers with responsibilities listed
President
The President shall be the chief executive of the club and responsible for its actions and the guidance of club leadership
President shall have signature responsibility
Vice President
The Vice President is the second Minister in hierarchy
The Vice President will assume the executive responsibilities of President in their absence
The Vice President shall be emissary to groups wishing entreaty with our club
The Vice President will be responsible for the laptops owned by our organization.
Treasurer
The Treasurer shall be the Chief Financial Officer for the Club
The Treasurer shall be responsible for all matters of budget and buying items.
The Treasurer shall prepare and provide all necessary ledgers and assessments of club wealth as required by the SGA and other bodies of oversight
The Treasurer shall have signature responsibility
Event Coordinator
Event Coordinator shall be responsible for the execution of club tournaments and large scale events
Will also be responsible for reserving location space for officer meetings.
Secretary 
Secretary shall be responsible for the weekly operations of club meetings, in-houses, as well as other small scale events
Secretary shall be responsible for club proclamations
Secretary shall be responsible for the maintenance of an accurate membership list
Secretary is responsible for social media responsibilities, mailbox, checking shipments and notes during officer meetings. 

Section 4
(Elections) 
Elections will be held using the campus pulse voting system. 

Candidates must announce the roles they want to run for before the elections. 

Voting is done in the order of: 
	-President
	-Vice President
	-Treasurer
	-Event Coordinator
	-Secretary 
Section 5
(Removal)
Any officer may be impeached from office for failure to perform the duties of their office or for conduct that is detrimental to the group.
The following procedure must be followed in order for  an officer to be impeached:
A motion must be made and seconded advocating for the impeachment of an officer
These motions may be conducted in private directly to an officer or in public at an official meeting
In the event that the motion is supported by two people an impeachment trial shall be held presided over by the President and the non-accused officers shall also be judges
In the event that the President is on trial, the Vice President shall preside
The Officer presiding over the trial shall designate a time available to all wishing to present evidence and the Judges shall hear all witnesses for and against independently and privately 
Following the presentation of evidence from the petitioner, the judges shall discuss and then vote
Impeachment requires a majority vote from the judges
In the event that the vote results in a tie, the matter shall be brought to a vote at the subsequent general body meeting following the allowance of 5 minutes of presentation from each willing witness
A general body vote requires a ⅔ majority to pass
If the voting results in impeachment, the officer shall immediately surrender his or her office.
If an issues arise during this process, or if either party wishes to appeal the results, the question may be taken by any member or officer to the Student Judiciary
Section 6
(Officer Vacancies)
If the President resigns or is impeached, the Vice President shall immediately take over as President
If the Vice President, The Treasurer, or Secretary resigns or is impeached, a special election shall be held for that position, following the same procedures as Section 5 of this charter.
The remaining members of the Executive Board shall schedule a special election at a regularly scheduled meeting between 1 and 3 weeks from the date the office became vacant. The Secretary shall inform the general membership of the date of the special election no less than 1 week prior.
Section 7
(Meetings)
The ESports Club shall have general meetings on a weekly basis.
Meetings shall be chaired by any officers.
The purpose of the meetings shall be:
Conducting administrative affairs
Playing ESports related games.
Planning tournaments, events, and Collegiate league strategies.
Watching professional tournaments and matches online.
Discussing ESports news, patch changes, and general game knowledge.
Teach inexperienced players tips and strategies.
Announcements will begin at 2PM sharp with a minimum of 15 minutes at the start of every meeting dedicated to procedural duties
This includes announcements, elections, amendments, impeachment and any other club procedures
Decisions will be made at meetings by a majority vote of the general membership.
A vote may only be held following a minimum of one week’s notice to the club 
Votes may be taken with a quorum greater than 10 voting members
If 10 members are not present during the meeting the voting will be pushed back to the end of the meeting when 10 members are present. 

Section 8
(Amendments)
The Charter may be amended by a 2/3 vote by the general club body held at an annual meeting for this purpose
A motion to amend may be made by any member at a meeting of the general membership. The motion shall be presented at the meeting in which the motion is made. Voting on the motion shall take place at the following meeting. Prior to voting, the President shall allow for a period of debate.
Following the passage of an amendment, an updated version of this charter shall be submitted to the Secretary of the Registry for final approval
The Vice president and President are responsible for looking over the constitution.
